title: Increase from 40~ to ~250 ping every hour on the hour
body:
Hello! 

I just recently started having these periods of increase ping. Today I decided to record it.

It appears that every hour on the hour I jump from ~40 ping to ~250 ping. If I leave and rejoin the game, I return to my normal ping. However, if I do not leave, the ping seems to never drop back down.

I know it seems strange but it happened at 12:00, 2:00, 4:00, and 5:00. It would seem like a strange coincidence.

I was wondering if anyone had any insight on this problem or could recommend some steps I can take to troubleshoot it myself.

Thanks!

replies.body: Sudden spikes like this can be caused by network problems like packet loss.  This could result from a poor connection or even how your ISP is routing to the game server.  I recommend starting off by getting a clear overview of your specific issue through a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader).  Let me know what you find!

Thanks for the response!

I don't know exactly how the logging works, but it appears like it stops logging once I exit the game as a lot of these logs are saved on the hour or very near the hour.

You can see from the link below that there are certainly increases in ping whenever I am in game on the hour. Those logs are from 12, 1, 2, and 4 p.m.

http://imgur.com/a/CP1x5

Looking at my other logs, my ping seems stable.

As for next steps, think I should just go straight to talking to my ISP?

Thanks!

*Edit: Hopefully as I monitor this, it might just fix itself and go away too.

Thanks for the detailed info!   It looks like you've got some network problems, but there are steps you can take to tune things up on your side before needing to contact your ISP.  More specifically, go over the steps of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to strengthen up your network.  If you still continue to have issues like packet loss, then we can go from there.  Let me know if it helps!
